title: Culture: Activities (Usefulness 1)
description: Traveler usefulness 1/10 phrases for the Activities subcategory within Culture. Includes 6 card(s).

cards.english: Japanese people enjoy a game at the beach during the summer in which you have to find and split a watermelon with a stick while blindfolded.
cards.romaji: Nihon-jin wa, natsu ni umi de mekakushi o shite suika o waru g.mu o shimasu.
cards.japanese: 日本人は、夏に海で目隠しをしてスイカを割るゲームをします。

cards.english: Elementary school children learn calligraphy at school.
cards.romaji: Sh gakusei wa, gakk no shod no jugy de sh.ji o naraimasu.
cards.japanese: 小学生は、学校の書道の授業で習字を習います。

cards.english: In summer, children enjoy hand-held fireworks at the beach.
cards.romaji: Natsu ni wa, kodomo-tachi wa umi de temochi no hanabi de asobimasu.
cards.japanese: 夏には、子供たちは海で手持ちの花火で遊びます。

cards.english: Hot springs are not only relaxing, but are also believed to have medical healing properties.
cards.romaji: onsen wa, rirakkusu dekiru dakedenaku, chiry k ka mo aru to iwarete imasu.
cards.japanese: 温泉は、リラックスできるだけでなく、治療効果もあると言われています。

cards.english: Autumn is traditionally considered a good season for reading in Japan.
cards.romaji: nihon dewa, aki wa dokusho ni saiteki no kisetsu to sarete imasu.
cards.japanese: 日本では、秋は読書に最適な季節とされています。

cards.english: In a stressful modern society, many people in Japan seek relaxation in reflexology salons.
cards.romaji: kindai no sutoresu shakai ni oitewa, .ku no hito ga iyashi ya rifurekusoroj. o motomete imasu.
cards.japanese: 近代のストレス社会においては、多くの人が癒しやリフレクソロジーを求めています。
